answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples of agricultural zoning policies.
This policy is from Gaines Charter Township in Michigan.
http://www.gainestownship.org/ordinances_reports/pdfs_ordinances/zoning/Chapter%205%20-%20Agricultural%20and%20Rural%20Residendtial%20Zoning%20Districts.pdf
Another example is from Howard County, MD.
http://www.hceda.org/agriculture/bizDev.aspx?details=zoning
I have also included some reports on agricultural business zoning.
This report is from the Agricultural Law Resource and Reference Center at the Penn State Dickinson School of Law. 
http://law.psu.edu/_file/aglaw/Agricultural_Zoning.pdf
You may also be interested in this fact sheet from the American Farm Land Trust.
http://www.farmlandinfo.org/documents/29478/FS_APZ_9-98.pdf
I also found a document about the collaborative effort behind the City of High Springs's Farmers’  Market.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/100118/City_of_High_Springss_Farmers_Market
I hope these offer some help! 
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is requesting copies of your documents related Agriculture/Business Zoning.  That is, local farms that operate businesses on their farm land (produce stands, goods & services etc.).
Thank you in advance for your help!
Pamela G Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Agriculture/Business Zoning
